question:
(a) Using appropriate diagrams, explain the process of formation of a
(i) river capture
(ii) waterfall

(b) Describe one way in which each of the two features above is useful to man
answer:
(a)(i) River Capture: This is also called river piracy or river beheading. It results when a river through head water of erosion into a water divide cuts up the headwater of another but a weaker river. The river pirated is called misfit and the point of capture is called elbow of capture The valley below the elbow is called wind gap. 

(i) Waterfall: This is formed as a result of unequal resistance of hard and soft rocks transverse by a river. The out crop of a band of hard rock may cause a river to fall downstream in greater dimension from some heights called waterfall 

(b) One way in which river capture is useful to man is channelization of water away from settlements while waterfall is useful for the generation of hydro-electric power

question:
(a) On an outline map of Nigeria locate and name
(i) the source areas and the destinations of two named major items of internal trade, indicate by an arrow the direction of movement of each commodity. (ii) one important town in each area

(b) Outline four factors that have favoured the development of internal trade in Nigeria
answer:
(b) Four factors that have favoured the development of internal trade include:

(i) Wide demand for such goods

(ii) Good transportation network

(iii) Favourable climate for the cultivation of the crops

(iv) Differences in products

question:
(a) On a sketch map of Nigeria, locate and name
(i) one area important for the mining of each of limestone, tin, crude oil and coal
(ii) one major town in each area

(b) Explain the importance of any one of the minerals to the economy of Nigeria

(c) Outline any four problems facing the mining industry in Nigeria.
answer:
(b) Importance of crude oil to the economy of Nigeria; 

(i) Crude oil provides essential products like petrol and kerosine

(ii) It provides employment to Nigerians

(iii) It also provides raw materials for industries

(iv) It provides foreign exchange for the nation

(v) Provision of infrastructure like pipe borne water, good roads, electricity, etc

(c) Four problems facing the mining industry in Nigeria include;

(i) Environmental pollution

(ii) It leads to loss of farmlands

(iii) Lack of skilled labour

(iv) Inadequate transport facilities

question:
(a) Draw a sketch map of Nigeria to show
(i) the home areas of the following people: Fulani, lbibio, Yoruba and Urhobo
(ii) one major town in each home area

(b) Select any two of these peoples and explain the effects of the physical environment on their occupation and types of house
answer:
(b)(i) YORUBA: The effects of the physical environment and type of house in Yoruba land are:

(i) Yorubas are mainly involved in farming, weaving, carving, etc.
- Their houses are made of mud.
- Thatched houses and modern buildings are also seen in urban areas

(ii) FULANI: The effects of the physical environment and type of house in Fulani are :
(i) Fulanis are mainly involved in cattle rearing, farming and trading
(ii) Their houses are made of mobile tents made of grass and leaves, no permanent shelter or houses

question:
(a) On an outline map of Africa, locate and name
(i) two land-locked countries
(ii) two ports, each in a different country, serving these land-locked countries
(iii) the countries in which these ports are located

(b) What four major problems are facing land-locked countries in Africa?
answer:
(b) Four major problems facing landlocked countries in Africa are:

(i) There is economic dependence on other countries

(ii) There is loss of revenue due to smuggling

(iii) There is also the problem of political insecurity

(iv) There is high cost of freight rate
